alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN LOS ALAMOS AND EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 243 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Frijoles, or 10 miles southwest of Los Alamos, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cochiti Lake, Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
